page.title: 05 Railways
page.content:
Next to the main road runs a small single track{railway line}which connects{Ludgershall}to the main {London-Exeter}line near{Andover.} A very large network of lines were laid in the second half of the nineteenth century which brought growth and prosperity to many towns and villages.
In the early nineteen-sixties the lines were severely cut back because of the cost of running them and the railways left are still working at great expense. The line in this block used to be part of the passenger network but now is used to carry freight for the{Defence Department}to {Tidworth.
Much of the goods which used to be carried by train now have to be taken by road on lorries.
